page.title: 08THE GOLF COURSE
page.content: The Selkirk Golf Course is situated to the west of the Town on the South Common on lands owned by the Royal Burgh of Selkirk. The course is a nine hole . The local inhabitants are given a concessionary use although day and weekly tickets are available for the visitor. The clubhouse is a licenced premises and is used by local inhabitants. The area of the golf course is also used for for the recreational purpose of horse riding by the local people with whom the sport is extremely popular. There is a network off ridle paths to reduce the amount of conflict between the conflicting interests of the two sports.
